intro: Centaurea grisebachii subsp. confusa, commonly known as the grey-centred knapweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive greyish-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to southern Europe. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, and the flowers are arranged in dense, spherical heads. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
